TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebGetAttribute extends System.Attribute implements class System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior

Docs.summary: Represents an attribute indicating that a service operation is logically a retrieval operation and that it can be called by the WCF REST programming model.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> attribute is applied to a service operation in addition to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute> and associates the operation with a <xref:System.UriTemplate> as well as the HTTP protocol Get verb. The association with HTTP Get verb means that the operation is used to retrieve information from the service. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> attribute is a *passive* operation behavior (the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior> methods do nothing) that adds metadata to the operation description. Applying the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> attribute to a service operation has no effect unless a behavior that is looking for this metadata in the operation description (such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WebHttpBehavior>) is added to the service's behavior collection.
Service operations with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> attribute applied should be logical retrieval operations. The HTTP GET method is associated with all operations marked with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> attribute.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> attribute.
[!code-csharp[WebAttribute#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/webattribute/cs/program.cs#0)] [!code-vb[WebAttribute#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/webattribute/vb/program.vb#0)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets and sets the body style of the messages that are sent to and from the service operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When set to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle.Bare>, the result of the service operation is written directly to the body of the response message.
## Examples The following example shows how to set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute.BodyStyle%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[WebAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/webattribute/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebAttribute#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/webattribute/vb/program.vb#1)]

Docs.value: A value that specifies whether the property is set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is designed to be used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and should never be set from user code.

Docs.value: A value that specifies whether the property was set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is designed to be used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and should never be set from user code.

Docs.value: A value that specifies whether the property was set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is designed to be used by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] infrastructure and should never be set from user code.

## Remarks This property determines the format of requests made to a service operation. The two possible values are `Xml` and `Json`.
## Examples The following example shows how to set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute.RequestFormat%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[WebAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/webattribute/cs/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[WebAttribute#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/webattribute/vb/program.vb#2)]

## Remarks This property determines the format of responses sent from a service operation. The two possible values are `Xml` and `Json`.
## Examples The following example shows how to set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute.ResponseFormat%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) template for the service operation.
Docs.value: The URI template for the service operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks URI templates are used to determine which requests get dispatched to which service operations. URI templates allow you to map a URI or a set of URIs to a service operation. [!INCLUDE[crabout](~/includes/crabout-md.md)] URI templates, see [UriTemplate and UriTemplateTable](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/uritemplate-and-uritemplatetable.md).
## Examples The following example shows how to set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute.UriTemplate%2A> property.
